scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Global media delivery site using Azure Front Door Standard/Premium with CDN, App Service origin for dynamic content, Blob Storage for media, and standard observability and security.

resources.notes: Azure Front Door Premium with integrated CDN for global delivery. Assumes ~50 TB/month egress globally and ~200M routing/HTTP requests. Throughput estimate ~800 Mbps peak. Includes WAF and rules engine for security and caching policies.

Premium v3 App Service Plan (Linux) with 2 instances for HA across availability zones. Hosts the web app and APIs serving dynamic content and origin for some media URLs. Egress mostly to Front Door within Azure (billed as inter-region bandwidth where applicable).
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux

resources.notes: Single web app running in the shared Premium v3 plan. No separate compute charge beyond the plan; included here for completeness and potential per-app features.
resources.product_name: Web App (logical, billed via App Service Plan)

resources.notes: General-purpose v2 storage account with Blob Storage for media origin. Assumes 10 TB total: 8 TB Hot, 2 TB Cool, 240 GB Archive. 50 TB/month egress via Front Door plus blob read/write operations. GRS for durability and geo-DR.

resources.notes: Standard C1 Redis cache for session state and frequently accessed metadata to reduce App Service and storage load. Zone redundant not available at this tier; can be upgraded if needed.
VNet for App Service regional VNet integration and private endpoints for storage and other PaaS services. No direct cost but required for private networking.
NAT Gateway for any outbound traffic from integrated workloads (e.g., background jobs, APIs) with a static public IP. Egress estimate 1 TB/month for non-CDN traffic.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard public IP for NAT Gateway. Billed per hour and per GB of data processed.
Private Endpoint for Blob Storage media origin to keep traffic on Microsoft backbone and avoid public exposure. Includes data processed via Private Link.
Standard Key Vault for TLS certificates, storage keys, and app secrets. Accessed via managed identities from App Service and automation.
Central Log Analytics workspace for App Service, Front Door diagnostics, Azure Monitor metrics, and activity logs. Assumes ~500 GB/month ingestion with default retention.
Recovery Services vault for backing up App Service content (via Azure Backup for Web Apps or scripts) and configuration. 250 GB protected data assumed.

resources.notes: Placeholder for DR of any supporting IaaS components or configuration servers if used. For pure PaaS, ASR may be minimal; included to model at least one protected instance as per guideline.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Lower-cost variant using Front Door Standard, smaller App Service footprint, LRS storage, and reduced observability and DR overhead while still supporting ~50 TB/month CDN egress.

resources.notes: Azure Front Door Standard with CDN for global delivery. Slightly fewer advanced rules than Premium but cheaper. 50 TB/month egress and ~150M requests assumed.
Single-instance Premium v3 plan with 1-year reserved capacity to reduce cost. Accepts lower HA (rely on platform resilience and Front Door health probes). Suitable if downtime tolerance is moderate.

scenarios.label: High Performance / Scale
scenarios.description: High-performance, highly available media delivery with Front Door Premium, scaled-out App Service, larger Redis, and geo-redundant storage optimized for heavy global traffic and spikes beyond 50 TB/month.

resources.notes: Front Door Premium with CDN tuned for high throughput and advanced WAF/rules. Assumes up to 75 TB/month egress and 400M requests to handle peaks above the baseline 50 TB.

Premium v3 P2v3 plan with 3 instances across zones for high availability and more CPU/RAM for dynamic processing, token validation, and origin logic. 1-year reserved capacity for cost efficiency at scale.

resources.notes: Premium P1 Redis with better performance, persistence options, and VNet integration. 1-year reserved capacity for cost optimization at high usage.
VNet with multiple subnets for App Service integration, Redis, and private endpoints. Designed for high-throughput private traffic.
Two NAT Gateways for higher outbound throughput and resiliency. Used for any backend services or management traffic.

resources.notes: Standard public IPs associated with the NAT Gateways.
Premium Key Vault for HSM-backed keys and higher security requirements, including TLS offload certificates and token signing keys.
Higher ingestion volume and potentially longer retention for detailed performance and security analytics.
Larger backup footprint and more frequent backups for configuration, content, and any supporting IaaS components.
